article_title: How the GOP Can Avoid Becoming the Pan Am Party
article_text:
Whether in business or in politics, brands age. Those who are unable or unwilling to adjust disappear. Companies like American Motors, Pan Am and Woolworth’s, once industry icons, no longer exist. When our management team took over at Hardee’s in 2000, we faced a similar fate. Republican presidential hopefuls should absorb the identity lessons that helped the company come back stronger.

article_summary:
When our management team took over at Hardee’s in 2000, we faced a similar fate.
Companies like American Motors, Pan Am and Woolworth’s, once industry icons, no longer exist.
Those who are unable or unwilling to adjust disappear.
By 1990, it was the third largest fast-food restaurant company in the world.
Republican presidential hopefuls should absorb the identity lessons that helped the company come back stronger.
